qas.question: As of 2000, how many people lived in Ceilândia?
As of 2000, how many people lived in Taguatinga?
As of 2000, how many people lived in the Plano Piloto?
What areas does Brasilia's public transit avoid?

answers.text: most of the political and tourist areas

qas.question: Where does the metro go after leaving the satellite cities?
What do most residents of the Rodoviaria depend on?

plausible_answers.text: Samambaia, Taguatinga and Ceilândia, as well as Guará and Águas Claras

qas.question: What tourist areas does the metro serve?
What areas served are more populated than the political areas?
According to the 2000 census, how  many people lived in Guara?

context: The metro leaves the Rodoviária (<a0_0>bus station<a0_0/>) and <b5_0>goes south<b5_0/>, avoiding <a4_0>most of the political and tourist areas<a4_0/>. The main purpose of the metro is to serve cities, such as <b7_0>Samambaia, Taguatinga and Ceilândia, as well as Guará and Águas Claras<b7_0/>. The <b8_0>satellite cities<b8_0/> served are more populated in total than the Plano Piloto itself (the census of 2000 indicated that Ceilândia had <a1_0><b9_0>344,039<b9_0/><a1_0/> inhabitants, Taguatinga had <a2_0>243,575<a2_0/>, whereas the Plano Piloto had <a3_0>approximately 400,000<a3_0/> inhabitants), and most residents of the satellite cities depend on <b6_0>public transportation<b6_0/>.
